de.japi

Class Japi2Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.japi.Japi2Session
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Japi2Session
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents the main session of a JAPI2 kernel connection. It manages the execution of so called "JAPI calls". This are commands from the client to perform a specific action (e.g. open a frame etc.). In this Java context the execution of a JAPI call is considered as a JAPI2 service call execution.

    A JAPI call or JAPI2 service call is an identifying number (id) of a specific action. By example: if the client sends the id or command "2112" he wants to let the computer beep. So this session needs to execute some code to perfom this action. The code for those commands is packed into static methods which are then executed.

    This class provides seven methods to read parameters from the client during the JAPI2 service execution from the socket's input stream. Those methods are (see the individual method documentation for further information):

    • read()
    • read(byte[], int)
    • readString(int)
    • readInt()
    • #readInts(int)
    • readLine()
    • #canRead()

    This class also provides three methods to write return values of a JAPI2 service execution back to the client. Since the JAPI2 kernel creates two output connections to the client (the command output and the action output), the methods require an additional parameter to specify the target stream. Due to the fact that the command stream is used more extensively, this class provides aliases for all write methods which will be directly write to the command stream. All supported methods are:

    • writeBytes(byte[], de.japi.Japi2Session.TargetStream) and writeBytes(byte[])
    • writeInt(int, de.japi.Japi2Session.TargetStream) and writeInt(int)
    • writeString(java.lang.String, de.japi.Japi2Session.TargetStream) and writeString(java.lang.String)

    Beside the methods for reading and writing to the client this class provides also methods for the management of the GUI objects assigned to this session and the logging appropriate to the specification of the JAPI docs.

      static class  Japi2Session.TargetStream
      This enum is used on write methods of the class Japi2Session to specify the right stream to write on.

        public <T> T getObjectById(int id,
                           java.lang.Class<T> type)
                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrives an object related to the current session identified by the given id.
        Type Parameters:
        T - this method uses generic type parameters to create properly typed code at compile time.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the object.
        type - the type of the expected object.
        Returns:
        the object or null if the id is not existing or the object cannot be cast to the desired type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - is thrown if the value cannot be casted to the desired type.

        public int getIdByObject(java.lang.Object object)
        Looks up the id for a given GUI object.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the id of the object (always greater than 0) or -1.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run method for the Runnable interface. This method should not be called directly.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendResult

        public static final boolean sendResult(int command)
        This method indicated if a negative result (i.e. the integer -1) should be send to the client if an exception occurred during the execution of a Japi call. If this Japi call whould normally return an ID to the client, on error a -1 must be send.
        Parameters:
        command - the id of the Japi call to check.
        Returns:
        true if the negative result should be send or false if nothing should be done.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • log1

        public final void log1(java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a program debug message of level 1. This logging message is sent to the Japi2DebugWindow (if the appropriate log level is set) and to the debug output method (only if program in developer mode) Japi2.debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

        By defioniton of the JAPI documentation, this method should be called to log messages of the following type: 

         Rueckmeldung der konstruktiven Funktionen. Nur das Erzeugen der 
 graphischen Objekte wird protokolliert.

        Parameters:
        msg - the message to log. This message is send through the formatter of MessageFormat. That means, placeholders of the type '{' [0-9] '} can be used to insert an argument from the args array.
        args - The arguments to place in the message.

      • log2

        public final void log2(java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a program debug message of level 2. This logging message is sent to the Japi2DebugWindow (if the appropriate log level is set) and to the debug output method (only if program in developer mode) Japi2.debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

        By defioniton of the JAPI documentation, this method should be called to log messages of the following type: 

         Wie 1, zusaetzliche Ausgabe aller Aktionen, die vom Benutzer ausgefuehrt 
 werden.

        Parameters:
        msg - the message to log. This message is send through the formatter of MessageFormat. That means, placeholders of the type '{' [0-9] '} can be used to insert an argument from the args array.
        args - The arguments to place in the message.

      • log3

        public final void log3(java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a program debug message of level 3. This logging message is sent to the Japi2DebugWindow (if the appropriate log level is set) and to the debug output method (only if program in developer mode) Japi2.debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

        By defioniton of the JAPI documentation, this method should be called to log messages of the following type: 

         Wie 2, zusaetzlich werden alle weiteren Funktionen (ausser den 
 graphischen Befehlen) protokoliert.

        Parameters:
        msg - the message to log. This message is send through the formatter of MessageFormat. That means, placeholders of the type '{' [0-9] '} can be used to insert an argument from the args array.
        args - The arguments to place in the message.

      • log4

        public final void log4(java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a program debug message of level 4. This logging message is sent to the Japi2DebugWindow (if the appropriate log level is set) and to the debug output method (only if program in developer mode) Japi2.debug(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

        By defioniton of the JAPI documentation, this method should be called to log messages of the following type: 

         Wie 3, zusaetzlich mit allen graphischen Befehlen.

        Parameters:
        msg - the message to log. This message is send through the formatter of MessageFormat. That means, placeholders of the type '{' [0-9] '} can be used to insert an argument from the args array.
        args - The arguments to place in the message.

      • readByte

        public int readByte()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an unsigned byte from the input stream. This method blocks.
        Returns:
        the read unsigned byte.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.read()

      • read

        public void read(byte[] buf,
                 int length)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads the given number of bytes (length) from the input stream and stores them into the given byte array. This method is a blocking method, i.e. it will only return if length number of bytes are read.
        Parameters:
        buf - the array to store the read data into.
        length - the number of bytes to read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the array buf is shorter than length.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(int length)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a String from the input stream with a fixed length. This method is a blocking method.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to read (length of the string).
        Returns:
        the String read in and never null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readInt

        public int readInt()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next Integer from the input stream. An integer number consists of four bytes of data. The endian scheme for decoding is defined by Japi2Session#toInt(byte[]). This method is a blocking call, i.e. once the stream has only three bytes left, this method call will only return if the fourth byte is available.
        Returns:
        the read Integer as primitive type (never null).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next line of characters from the input stream. A line is terminated by a line feet or an \n escape sign. This method does not block if the stream is fully read and the line is not terminated. In this case the read string is returned. This implementation adapts the (deprecated) implementation of DataInputStream.readLine().
        Returns:
        the string read from the input socket which is terminated by a line feet.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int i)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an Integer to the client through the command socket. This call is an alias for writeInt(i, TargetStream.COMMAND).
        Parameters:
        i - the Integer to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int a,
                     Japi2Session.TargetStream target)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an Integer, consisting of four bytes, onto the given socket stream (target). The endian encoding of the integer is defined by the method #toByte(int).
        Parameters:
        a - the Integer to write.
        target - the target stream to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBoolean

        public void writeBoolean(boolean b)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Wrties a Boolean value onto the command stream. The boolean value true is represented by a 1 and the boolen value false is represented by a 0. The value is written as an Integer number onto the stream, meaning that four bytes are used to encode the boolean.
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String str)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String object onto the command socket. This method call is an alias for writeString(str, TargetStream.COMMAND).
        Parameters:
        str - the String to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String str,
                        Japi2Session.TargetStream target)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String object onto the given socket stream (target). This is done in this way:
        1. the number of characters of the string is written onto the stream
        2. all characters of the string are written individually onto the stream
        Parameters:
        str - the String to write. If it is null then an empty string is written onto the stream.
        target - the target stream to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] b)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an array of Bytes onto the command socket stream. This method is an alias for: writeBytes(b, TargetStream.COMMAND).
        Parameters:
        b - the bytes to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] b,
                       Japi2Session.TargetStream target)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an array of Bytes onto the given socket stream (target).
        Parameters:
        b - the bytes to write.
        target - the target stream to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
